intro: Boechera rectissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arid environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
